title: Login - Authorized User
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user clears cache (or uses an Incognito Browser)
AND navigates to Cerebro page
AND is redirected to the Okta login
custom_steps: WHEN a user logins with username and password for user assigned to Cerebro
custom_expected: THEN the user will be redirected back to the Cerebro home page

title: Login - Unauthorized User
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user clears cache (or uses an Incognito Browser)
AND navigates to Cerebro page
AND is redirected to the Okta login
custom_steps: WHEN a user logins with username and password for user not assigned to Cerebro
custom_expected: THEN the user will not be redirected to the Cerebro page

title: Logout
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Logout
custom_expected:
THEN the user is logged out
AND can login to Okta again

title: Event Summary - Header
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro page
custom_steps: WHEN a user views the header
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the following:
MLB logo
Schedule Channel text button
Status dropdown Filter
Date Filter
Logout Button

title: Event Summary - Status Filter Options
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects the Filter for Status
custom_expected:
THEN user can filter by 
All
Pending
Scheduled
Live
Ended
Archived

title: Event Summary - Status Filter
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Status Filter
AND selects a status
custom_expected: THEN the Channels with that status are displayed

title: Event Summary - Filter Defaults
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Event Summary
AND views the filter
custom_expected:
Then the default filters are
Status - All
Date - current Start and End Date (today's date)

title: Event Summary - Date Filter
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Date Filter
AND selects Start Date
AND selects End Date
custom_expected: THEN the event(s) with stream start between those dates are displayed

title: Event Summary - Sort Order
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user views channels on Event Summary
custom_expected: THEN the channels sorted in descending by stream start date and time

title: Event Summary - Fields - Auto Scheduled
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user views events on Event Summary for an event that is auto scheduled
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the following fields displayed
Thumbnail
Title
Status and Node
Auto Schedule icon
Stream Start Time and Program Start Time
Stream Duration
Action button (Delete or Archive) - depending on the status

title: Event Summary - Fields - Manual
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user views events on Event Summary for an event that is not auto scheduled
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see the following fields displayed
Thumbnail
Title
Status and Node
Stream Start Time
Stream Duration
Action button (Delete or Archive) - depending on the status

title: Event Summary - In Focus
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views channels on Event Summary
AND a user mouses over an event
custom_expected: Then the event card will be in focus

title: Event Summary - Status Color
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user views Status column for channels on Event Summary
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the following status and color
Pending - Black
Scheduled - Orange
Live - Green
Ended - Black
Archived - Black

title: Event Summary - Schedule Channel
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Schedule Channel
custom_expected: THEN the /create page will open

title: Event Summary - Verify GET /events returns 401 Status Code without Authorization Header
Event Summary - Verify GET /events returns 400 Status Code without startDate Param
Event Summary - Verify GET /events returns 400 Status Code with start date after end date
Event Summary - Verify GET /events returns 200 Status Code and Response and Schema Validation - Ad Hoc
Event Summary - Verify GET /events returns 200 Status Code and Response and Schema Validation - MLB Game
Verify GET /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 400 Status Code and Response for Invalid Event Type
Verify GET /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 404 Status Code and Response for Event Not Found
Verify GET /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 200 Status Code and Response - Authorization Imp - BDATA_MEDIA_SERVICE
Verify GET /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 200 Status Code and Response - Authorization Imp - COMMERCE_ENTITLEMENT_SERVICE
Verify GET /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 200 Status Code and Response - Authorization Imp - NONE
Verify POST /events/{eventId}/playback-info returns 405 Status Code and Response for Wrong Method
Schedule Channel - Required Fields
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
AND clicks on Schedule Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN a user tries to Schedule an event
OR Saves for Later
custom_expected:
THEN the following items are required
Blurb
Title
Description
Stream Start Date and Stream End Date
Node
Profile

title: Schedule Channel - Blurb length
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user types in the Blurb
custom_expected: Then the form takes between 3-53 characters

title: Schedule Channel - Blurb Popover Warning
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user types 1 or 2 characters in the Blurb
AND clicks Schedule It
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner - Please fix the invalid Forge metadata.
AND red box around the Blurb input box
AND red message below the Blurb - This value must be at least 3 characters

title: Schedule Channel - Title length
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user types in the Title
custom_expected: Then the form takes 33 characters

title: Schedule Channel - Description Length
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user types in the Description
custom_expected: Then the form takes 140 characters

title: Schedule Channel - Invalid Stream Start and End Time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
AND enters valid Forge Metadata
custom_steps:
When a user enters an invalid date or no Stream Start and End Time

Stream Start Date & Time and Stream End Date & Time the same
Stream Start Date & Time after Stream End Date and Time
No Stream Start Date & Time and Stream End Date & Time (click X to clear them)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see red box around the Stream Start Date & Time boxes
AND see a red banner - Please correct the stream start and end time. Make sure the start time is before the end time.

title: Schedule Channel - Auto Schedule - Off
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Create Schedule form
custom_steps: When the user views the Auto Schedule box
custom_expected:
THEN the Auto Schedule box is unchecked by default
AND the Program Start and End Time text and date picker will be greyed out
AND user can not set a Program Start and End Time
AND Program Start and End Time will match Stream Start and End Time

title: Schedule Channel - Auto Schedule - On
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Create Schedule form
custom_steps:
WHEN the user views the auto schedule box
AND clicks the empty box
custom_expected:
THEN the Auto Schedule box is checked
AND the Program Start and End Time text and date picker will not be greyed out
AND user can set a Program Start and End Time

title: Schedule Channel - Invalid Program Start and End Time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
AND enters valid Forge Metadata
AND enters valid Stream Start and End Time
AND checks Auto Schedule
custom_steps:
When a user enters an invalid date or no Program Start and End Time

Program Start Date & Time and Program End Date & Time the same
Program Start Date & Time after Program End Date and Time
No Program Start Date & Time and Program End Date & Time (click X to clear them)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see red box around the Program Start Date & Time boxes
AND see a red banner - Please correct the program start and end time. The start time must occur before the end time.

title: Schedule Channel - Program time within Stream time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
AND enters valid Forge Metadata
AND checks Auto Schedule
AND enters valid Stream Start and End Time
custom_steps: WHEN a user enters Program Start Time or Program End Time that is not within the Stream Start and End Time
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see red box around the Program Start Date & Time boxes
AND see a red banner - The program start and end date must be within the stream time range

title: Schedule Channel - Thumbnail Upload
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user views the form
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see
an upload file icon
line of text - `Max file size: 5mb, accepted: jpg|png`
Choose image button

title: Schedule Channel - Thumbnail Upload - PNG
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user clicks on Upload image button
AND selections a PNG file
AND the file is less than 5mb
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the uploaded image on the form

title: Schedule Channel - Thumbnail Upload - JPG
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user clicks on Upload image button
AND selections a JPG file
AND the file is less than 5mb
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the uploaded image on the form

title: Schedule Channel - Thumbnail Upload - Incorrect File Format
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user clicks on Upload image button
AND selections a file that is not PNG or JPG
custom_expected:
THEN the file will not be uploaded
AND the user will see the `* <fileName.ext> is not a supported file extension` text in red

title: Schedule Channel - Thumbnail Upload - Max File Size
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user clicks on Upload image button
AND selections a JPG or PNG file
AND the file is more than 5mb
custom_expected:
THEN the file will not be uploaded
AND the user will see the `* <fileName.ext> file size is too big` text in red

title: Schedule Channel - Node
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user views the form
custom_expected: Then the user will have a dropdown to select Node

title: Schedule Channel - Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: When a user views the form
custom_expected: Then the user will have a dropdown to select Profile

title: Schedule Channel - Profile Elemental Parameters
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects a profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a series of Elemental Parameters
AND the Parameters match the configuration in Elemental 

Check Cerebro Admin or Elemental

title: Schedule Channel - Network Input
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects a Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see Network Input
AND the format is rtp, ip address, port number

rtp://239.130.106.131:9000 - (MLB Network for Test, need a valid multicast or won't work in Elemental)

title: Schedule Channel - Format - DIAMONDLive - Local
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects Profile
AND selects any profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see DIAMONDLive - Local field
AND see the field pre-populated based on the Stream Start Date & Title
AND the format will match

/mnt/nas01-client/ELEM-LIVE/{$YYYY}/{$YYYY-MM}/${DD}/{$YYYYMMDD}-{$title}-LIVE

title: Schedule Channel - Pre-Populate Parameters - DIAMONDLive - Local

custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects Profile
AND selects any profile
AND a user updates the Title and/or Start Date
custom_expected:
THEN the DIAMONDLive - Local field will update correctly
AND the format will match

/mnt/nas01-client/ELEM-LIVE/{$YYYY}/{$YYYY-MM}/${DD}/{$YYYYMMDD}-{$title}-LIVE

WHEN a user fills in the other required fields

THEN the user will see DIAMONDLive - Cloud field
AND see the field pre-populated based on the Stream Start Date & Title
AND the format will match

title: Schedule Channel - Pre-Populate Parameters - DIAMONDLive - Cloud
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects Profile
AND selects any profile
AND a user updates the Title and/or Start Date
custom_expected:
THEN the DIAMONDLive - Cloud field will update correctly
AND the format will match

s3://mlb-entmedia-diam-elem-hls/ELEM-LIVE/{$YYYY}/{$YYYY-MM}/${DD}/{$YYYYMMDD}-{$title}-LIVE

title: Schedule Channel - Format - hlsCloud
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields

THEN the user will see hlsCloud field

AND the format will match

title: Schedule Channel - Pre-Populate Parameters - hlsCloud
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects Profile
AND selects any profile
AND a user updates the Title and/or Start Date

title: Schedule Channel - Elemental Parameters
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND the title includes special characters (&)
AND spaces between words
custom_expected:
THEN the parameters are pre-populated based on Title and Start Date
AND the special characters are removed
AND dashes between the spaces of the words
 
DIAMONDLive - Cloud
DIAMONDLive - Local
hlsCloud

title: Schedule Channel - Slate Picker
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a profile that has a slate 
AND fills in the other required fields
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see Starting Slate text
AND a scroll card to choose between slates

title: Schedule Channel - No Slate Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: WHEN a user selects a profile that has a no slate
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see a Starting Slate scroll picker

title: Schedule Channel - Slate Picker Selected
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND selects a slate
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a red highlight around the slate image

title: Schedule Channel - Schedule It button
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a Schedule It button (green)

title: Schedule Channel - Save for Later button
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps: WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a Save for later button (blue)

title: Schedule Channel - Schedule It button animation
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the other required fields
AND the user clicks on the Save For Later (blue)
OR the user clicks on the Schedule It button (green)
custom_expected: THEN the user will see 3 dot pulsing animation on both buttons

title: Schedule a Channel - Scheduled - Forge Shell
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user schedules an event
AND selects a profile that has Forge enabled
AND clicks on Schedule button

(Tell in the Cerebro Admin Portal on Profile Detail page)
custom_expected:
THEN a shell entity is created in Forge
AND the metadata is consistent
AND the status is not published

Title - <Title> : <EventId>
Blurb - <Blurb>
Description - <Description>
Slug - <title>-<eventid>

title: Schedule a Channel - Streaming - Forge Publish
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Schedule event
AND the profile is Forge enabled
AND user clicks on Schedule It
custom_expected:
THEN a shell entity is updated
AND the metadata is consistent
AND the event id is removed from the title (in Forge)
AND the status is published

Title - <Title>
Blurb - <Blurb>
Description - <Description>
Slug - <title>-<eventid>
Thumbnail Image
Tags

title: Schedule a Channel - Scheduled - No Forge Shell
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Schedule event
AND the profile is not Forge enabled
AND user clicks on Schedule It

(Tell in the Cerebro Admin Portal on Profile Detail page)
custom_expected: THEN a shell entity is not created in Forge

title: Schedule Channel - Duplicate Event Error
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Schedule Event form
AND enters all required information
AND enters the same title for an existing event
AND clicks on Schedule it
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner - There was a problem creating a channel in Conductor. Name has already been taken
AND the user will still be on the schedule event page

title: Schedule a Channel - Valid Status for Clone
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on an event in one of following:
Scheduled
Live
Ended
Archived
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a Clone button on the bottom (purple)

title: Schedule a Channel - Invalid Status for Clone
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on an event in one of following:
Pending
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see a Clone button on the bottom (purple)

title: Schedule a Channel - Clone data
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
AND is on an event with a status that can be cloned
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Clone
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to a new create event form
AND the information will be carried over to the form

title: Schedule a Channel - Clone data for Blurb and Title
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
AND is on an event with a status that can be cloned
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Clone
custom_expected:
Then the user will see [CLONE] added to the end of the Blurb and Title
AND the user can edit the Forge metadata (Burb, Title, Description)

Schedule Channel - Verify GET /slates returns 200 Status Code
Schedule Channel - Verify GET /tags returns 200 Status Code

Schedule Channel - Verify POST /events returns 400 Status Code without JSON Body

Slack - Scheduled
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user schedules an event in Cerebro
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a Slack notification
AND video shell created in Forge message
AND links to Video and Forge

A video shell has been created in Forge for this ad hoc program, and the slug for the URL has been established:
Video URL: https://qa-aws.mlb.com/video/mlb-test-stream-for-testing-sb-843
Forge URL: https://forge-web.cms-qa.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/custom/video/ef99a0ea-2c25-4ad5-b6f3-e81d46545d76

**The Video URL will 404 (that is expected)

title: Slack - Start Stream
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user schedules an event in Cerebro
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a Slack notification
AND video shell has been published message
AND links to Video and Forge

This live ad hoc program has been published and is now streaming at the URL below. Metadata can be changed in Forge.
Video URL: https://qa-aws.mlb.com/video/kent-s-duel-busting-blast-test-842
Forge URL: https://forge-web.cms-qa.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/custom/video/f9cef424-2e91-4298-abb1-0e8563044e29

title: Auto Schedule On and Off in Elemental
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user schedules an event
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see schedule in Elemental
AND if the auto schedule is true then schedule is active
AND if the auto schedule is false then schedule is inactive
AND the Start time and duration matches the Stream Start & End Time

title: Auto Schedule On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps: THEN when current time is equal to stream start time
custom_expected:
THEN channel will go from Idle to Pre Processing to Running in Conductor
AND the stream will be live in Cerebro
AND user will see blue banner below video player - This event is being managed automatically by Cerebro
AND user will see message below Status -  This event is being managed automatically by Cerebro.

title: Auto Slate Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps: THEN when current time is equal to program start time
custom_expected:
THEN the current slate will be removed
AND Lift Slate button would be removed from the header
AND the red box around slate will be removed

title: Auto Slate On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps: THEN when current time is equal to program end time
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB - Thank You slate will be active
AND Lift Slate button would be visible in the header
AND the red box around slate will be around the MLB - Thank You slate

title: Auto Schedule Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps: THEN when current time is equal to stream end time
custom_expected:
THEN channel will go from Running to Post Processing to Idle in Conductor
AND the stream will be Ended in Cerebro

title: Manual Mode
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Manual Mode (during any state)
AND clicks Continue the Manual Mode confirmation prompt
custom_expected:
THEN the autoSchedule is set to false
AND the schedule in Conductor is set to disabled
AND stream start/stop and program start/stop is auto
AND the blue banner below video player will be removed - This event is being managed automatically by Cerebro
AND the message below Status will be removed - This event is being managed automatically by Cerebro.

title: User Interaction during Auto Schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled an event in Cerebro
AND the event is Auto Schedule Enabled
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on an action (Start Stream)
custom_expected:
THEN the stream will start
AND the auto slate on/off will still be auto
AND the stream off will still be auto

title: Check DELETE /events/{eventId}/schedule returns 401 Status Code without Authorization Header
Check DELETE /events/{eventId}/schedule returns 400 Status Code with Wrong Type
Check GET /events/{eventId}/schedule returns 400 Status Code with Wrong Method
Check DELETE /events/{eventId}/schedule returns 200 Status Code and autoScheduled is false
Event Details - Header
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the header
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the following
MLB logo that navigates the user Cerebro homepage
Schedule Channel button
Logout Button

title: Event Details - Video Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN a user views header
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a video player under the header

Video not started - text that says Streaming has not started.
Video playing - video player with controls

title: Event Details - Forge Metadata
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
custom_expected:
THEN under the video player in the left column
AND the user will see Blurb, Title, Description (with required *)
AND the user will see Stream Start Time & End Time
and the user will see Program Start Time & End Time
AND the user will see MLB and Forge links
AND the user will see Thumbnail (with uploaded image or default image)
AND the user will see Tags (with default tag and section to add additional tags)

title: Event Details - External Links
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
AND stream has been started
custom_expected:
THEN the user see a External Links section
AND hyperlink labeled MLB (points to the video on web)
and hyperlink labeled Forge (points to the item in Forge)

Example - https://qa-aws.mlb.com/video/abc-title
Example - https://forge-web.cms-qa.mlbinfra.com/#/wcm/custom/video/14529e48-3698-48eb-b424-2d92a05d6379

title: Event Details - Status
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN a user views the event details
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the Status section
AND see Current Status: field
AND see the status name and color of the channel

Scheduled - orange
Live - green
Ended - black
Archived - black

title: Event Details - Available Slates
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a scroll card to choose between slates

title: Event Details - Slate Active
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is viewing the event
custom_steps:
WHEN a user starts an event stream
AND the slate is running
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
Lift Slate button in the header
Slate running in the video player
Red bar around the slate that is currently selected

title: Event Details - No Slate Active

GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is viewing the event
custom_steps:
WHEN a user starts an event stream
AND the slate is not running
custom_expected:
Then the user will see
Lift Slate button in the header will not visible
Stream will be running in the video player
Red bar around the slate is not visible

title: Event Details - Elemental Parameters

custom_steps: WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see Elemental Parameters

title: Event Details - Lift Slate button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
AND the channel is live
custom_expected:
THEN the user can see a Lift Slate button in the header (red)
AND see a red highlight around the slate image

title: Event Details - Start Stream
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
AND the stream has not been started yet
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a Status section
AND see the Current Status: Scheduled
AND see Start Stream button

title: Event Details - Stop Stream
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
AND the channel is live
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a Status section
AND see the Current Status: Live
AND see Stop Stream button

title: Event Details - Stream button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND a user is on the event details
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views the event details for a scheduled event
AND the channel is ended
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a Status section
AND see the Current Status: Ended
AND the Start Stream button is not visible
AND the Stop Stream button is not visible

title: Event Details - Update Information - Schedule
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND the user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN the event is in a Scheduled state
custom_expected:
THEN the user can update the metadata in either column
AND the Update information will be available

Updates to the Elemental Parameters can be seen in Elemental
Updates to the Forge Metadata can be seen in Forge once the channel is started

title: Event Details - Update Information - Live
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an event is scheduled
AND the user is on the event details
custom_steps: WHEN the event is in a Live state
custom_expected:
THEN the user can not update the metadata in either column
AND the Update information will not be visable

Error - Invalid Forge Metadata
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user tries to schedule a channel without filling in the Forge metadata

Blurb
Title
Description
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner appear with text - `Please fix the invalid Forge metadata.`
AND the field(s) will have red text next to them - `This value cannot be blank`

title: Error - Stream Start Date and Time
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
When a user enters an invalid date or no date for Stream Start

Start Date and Time and End Date and Time the same
Start Date and Time after End Date and Time
No Start Date and Time and End Date and Time (click X to clear them)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with text - Please correct the stream start and end time. Make sure the start time is before the end time.
AND the user will see red box over the Date and Time input boxes

title: Error - Program Start Date and Time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
AND clicks to enable the Auto Schedule
custom_steps:
When a user enters an invalid date or no date for Program Start and End Time

Program Date and Time & End Date and Time the same
Start Date and Time after End Date and Time
No Program Start Date and Time & Program End Date and Time (click X to clear them)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with text - Please correct the program start and end time. The start time must occur before the end time.
AND the user will see red box over the Date and Time input boxes

title: Error - Program Start/End Before Stream Start/End
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
AND clicks to enable the Auto Schedule
custom_steps:
WHEN a user enters Stream Start and End Time
AND enters a Program Start and End Time outside the range of the Stream

Program Start before Stream Start
Program End after Stream End
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with text - The program start and end date must be within the stream time range
AND the user will see red box over the Date and Time input boxes

title: Error - No Node
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the required information
AND tries to schedule a channel without selecting a node
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner appear with text - `Please select an AWS Elemental encoder node.`
AND the node dropdown box will be in red

title: Error - No Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the required information
AND tries to schedule a channel without selecting a profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner appear with text - `Please select a profile and fill out the required channel parameters.`
AND the node dropdown box will be in red

title: Error - Invalid Channel Parameters
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the required information
AND the user tries to schedule a channel without filling in Elemental Parameters
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner appear with text - `Please fix the invalid channel parameters.`
AND the text field(s) will be highlighted in red
AND the text field(s) will have text next to the field(s) - `This value cannot be blank`
AND the Starting Stream will be highlighted in the red

title: Error - Conductor error
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the required information
AND the user tries to schedule a channel with Conductor error

Adding " to the Network Input
Not adding rtp:// to Network Input
Not adding IP to MLB Network Input
Not adding Port Number to Network Input
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with a message

There was a problem creating a channel in Conductor. Inputs input settings uri is invalid and cannot be parsed.
There was a problem creating a channel in Conductor. Inputs input settings uri must include a hostname and a port number
There was a problem creating a channel in Conductor. Inputs input settings uri must include a port number

title: Error - Duplicate Title
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Schedule Channel form
custom_steps:
WHEN a user fills in the required information
AND the user tries to schedule a channel with a title already in Cerebro
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a red banner with the text - There was a problem creating a channel in Conductor. Name has already been taken

title: Error - Profile Error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an issue with the api/v1/profiles?type=adhoc endpoint

(Use Charles Proxy to remote map to an invalid address)
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Schedule Channel
custom_expected: THEN the user will see error message banner - There's a problem fetching the ad hoc profiles from the backend.

title: Error - Backend Error
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an issue with the /api/v1/events endpoint

(Use Charles Proxy to remote map to an invalid address)
custom_steps: WHEN a user navigates to the Cerebro Event Summary page
custom_expected: THEN the user will see a red banner - There is a problem fetching the events from the server

title: Event Summary - Deleted Event - Pending Status
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has saved an event (Pending)
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a Red box
AND trash can icon
AND click on the box will show Delete confirmation

title: Event Summary - Deleted Event - Schedule Status
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has scheduled an event (Scheduled)
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a Red box
AND trash can icon
AND click on the box will show Delete confirmation

title: Event Summary - Delete Action button
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user views an event in Status of
Pending
Scheduled
custom_expected:
Then that event will see red square with trash can at the end of the line item
AND clicking on it will show Delete Event popover

title: Event Summary - Delete Confirmation Popover
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on the Delete button for an event
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a confirmation popover
Title - Delete Event
Text - You are about to delete the event Title. The resources associated with this event will be removed and the event will no longer be accessible through the event summary screen. This action cannot be reversed.
Buttons - Cancel and Delete

title: Event Summary - Delete Confirmation - Cancel
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on the Delete button for an event
AND is on the Delete confirmation
AND clicks on Cancel
custom_expected:
Then the popover will disappear
AND the event will still be in the event summary

title: Event Summary - Delete Confirmation - Delete a Pending Event
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Delete for an event in Pending status
AND clicks on Delete on the confirmation popover
custom_expected: THEN the event is no longer on the Event summary

title: Event Summary - Delete Confirmation - Delete a Scheduled Event
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Delete for an event in Scheduled status
AND clicks on Delete on the confirmation popover
custom_expected:
THEN the event is no longer on the Event summary
AND channel no longer in Elemental
AND entity no longer in Forge

title: Event Summary - Deleted event not displayed in UI
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has deleted a pending event
OR deleted a scheduled event
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Event Summary
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see the event

title: Event Summary - Deleted Event - Status
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has scheduled or is viewing an event with the following status
Live
Ended
Archived
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_expected: THEN the user will not be able to delete the event

custom_steps:
WHEN a user views an event in Status of
Ended
custom_expected:
Then that event will see green square with archive box at the end of the line item

title: Event Summary - Archive Confirmation Popover
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on the Archive button for an event
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a confirmation popover
Title - Archive Event
Text - You are about to archive the event <Event Title>. The resources associated with this event will be removed, however, the event will still be accessible through the event summary screen. This action cannot be reversed.
Buttons - Cancel and Archive

title: Event Summary - Archive Confirmation - Archive Event
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user clicks on Delete for an event in Pending status
AND clicks on Delete on the confirmation popover
custom_expected:
THEN the event is changed to Archive status
AND is still on the Event summary
AND the resource is removed in Elemental

title: Event Summary - Archive Event
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN a user filters by Archived
OR views All of the events
custom_expected: THEN the user will see Archived events via API and Frontend UI

title: Verify GET /sse/data returns 401 Status Code without Auth Header
Verify GET /sse/data returns 406 Status Code with Wrong Accept Header
Verify GET /sse/data returns 400 Status Code with Multiple Bearer Tokens
SSE Updates - Create Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user 1 has one browser open to Create form for a Pending Event
AND user 2 has another browser open to Create form for a Pending Event
custom_steps:
WHEN user 1 makes an update
AND clicks on Update Information
custom_expected:
THEN user 2 will not see the updates automatically
AND will need to manually refresh the page to see the updates

title: SSE Updates - Event Summary Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user 1 has one browser open to page in Cerebro
AND user 2 has another browser open to Event Summary
custom_steps:
WHEN user 1 creates a Pending Event
OR creates a Scheduled Event
OR updates information* on an event 

*Thumbnail, Title, Status, Node, Auto Schedule, Stream/Program Start Time, Stream Duration, Action icon
custom_expected: THEN user 2 will see the updates automatically without having to refresh page

title: SSE Updates - Event Detail Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user 1 has one browser open to Event Detail for an event (non pending)
AND user 2 has another browser open to Event Detail for the same event
custom_steps:
WHEN a user updates the information

Forge Metadata, Date and Time, Status, Elemental Paramters
custom_expected: THEN user 2 will see the updates automatically without having to refresh page

title: SSE Updates - Event Detail - Delete Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user 1 is open to Event Summary
AND user 2 is on Event Detail for an event
custom_steps: WHEN user 1 clicks on Delete action button for that event
custom_expected: THEN user 2 will be redirected back to the Event Summary

Admin Options
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is setup to access Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps: WHEN the user is on the main page
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the options and graphics for
Profiles
Slates
Types

title: Admin - Profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps: When the user clicks on Profiles
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Profiles screen

title: Admin - Profiles - Layout
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Profiles section
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see
MLB logo in the header (clicking navigates you to the Cerebro Admin Tool)
Add Profile button in the header
Drop down with Profiles text and Select a Profile text

title: Admin - Profiles - Dropdown
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on the dropdown by Profiles
custom_expected: THEN the user will see all of the Profiles currently in the system

title: Admin - Profiles - Add Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps: WHEN a user clicks on Add Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user sees a popup
Add Profile text
Conductor Profile Id field (required)
Display Name (required)
Cancel and Add Profile button

title: Admin - Add Profile Success
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Add Profile popover
AND enters valid Conductor Profile Id
AND enters Display text
AND clicks on Add Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a green confirmation banner
AND will see the added Profile in
Cerebro Admin Tool
Cerebro Operator Tool

title: Admin - Add Profile Error - Duplicate Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
AND the user has the Conductor Profile ID for a known Profile
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Add Profile popover
AND enters the existing Conductor Profile ID
AND enters a Display Name
AND clicks Add Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with the text

Could not add profile '<profileName>', conductor profile <profileId> is already associated.

title: Admin - Add Profile Error - Unknown Profile Id
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Add Profile popover
AND enters an unknown Conductor Profile Id
AND enters a Display Name
AND clicks on Add Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a red banner with the text

Could not add profile '<profileName>', conductor profile <profileId> was not found.

title: Admin - Add Profile - Validation
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps: WHEN a user is on the Add Profile popover
custom_expected:
THEN the user will not be able to add profile without
Profile Id
Display Name

title: Admin - Add Profile - Display Name Limit
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Add Profile popover
AND the user attempts to add a string of 256
custom_expected: THEN the string is cut off at 255 (character limit)

title: Admin - Update Profile Name
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
AND is on Profile
custom_steps:
WHEN a user selects a Profile from the dropdown
AND updates the Name
AND clicks on Save Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a green banner

The profile '<newProfileName' has been successfully updated.

AND the user will see the new Profile name in Cerebro Admin Tool
AND the user will see the new Profile name in Cerebro Operator Tool

title: Admin - Delete Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the Profile screen
AND selects a Profile
custom_expected:
THEN a user can see an option to Delete Profile (red)

**Don't delete currently, no way to actively add back a deleted Profile

title: Admin - Admin Slates
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is setup to access the Cerebro Admin Tool
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is on the main page
AND clicks on Slates
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to a drop down with available Slates
